website_summaries.verdict: Touchy temperature settings mar this otherwise reliable adjustable aquarium heater.
pros: Temperature presets and easy-to-read indicator are nice pluses, as is the calibration feature, users note
cons: Reports that the unit can overheat past the set temperature
Temperature settings are touchy and calibration doesn’t always take

customer_reviews.title: Great heaters
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Eheim Jager heaters in my aquariums for years and they're very reliable and very efficient. With any heater, expect 2-3 years life and just plan to replace them, especially if you care about your pets(fish). Don't be cheap and expect them to last for much longer. They're the best priced, quality heaters, cheaper than the higher quality brands. The cons, they're clumsy to operate and dial in and the electrical cord is so thick that they are clumsy as well to get in your tank and hide, they are best suited in a sump or large tank where you can hide them.
customer_reviews.author: Digity Dog

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully as reliable as the previous Jager
customer_reviews.text: The Eheim Jager box looked to have been previously opened. I hope this was not someone's returned heater. Anyway, my previous Eheim Jager lasted at least 17 years, hopefully this new heater will last at least half as long. My previous Eheim Jager was a 100 Watt, this one is a 125 Watt. Internet "experts" recommended 125 Watt for 35 gallon aquarium, side panel on Eheim Jager box states 100 Watt for 26-40 gallon aquarium size. See photo. The 125 Watt should not be overkill. Simple calibration of adjusting ring to match water temperature and heater dial. Heater is staying within a degree with some house temperature fluctuations.
customer_reviews.author: Dorwinion

customer_reviews.title: These are JUNK. They will NEVER calibrate.
customer_reviews.text: These heaters were once upon a long time ago the best money could buy. Now they are pure garbage that come to you uncalibrated and are impossible to ever calibrate. I’ve tried over and over again over a month in which time the return window closed. So now I’m stuck with these expensive pieces of junk that consistently heat to 4°F higher than your setting. Maybe I’ll use them as light saber props or maybe I’ll shove them in the face of the next Eheim rep I see.
customer_reviews.author: Shibli Zaman

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed...
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed by this heater. I found that it could not hold the temperate I set it too. Even if I turned the nob all the way down to 75 (the temp I wanted), the heater would still stay on till it reached 82, and continually keep it there. I am not genius when it comes to aquarium heaters, but I have had many before and this one really let me down. No, I would not recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vanotrov

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: THERE IS NO WARRANTY ON THIS. BUYER BEWARE. They may claim there is a warranty but if they do not return emails and inquiries on defective items, the warranty is useless. Worked great for 6 months at keeping the temp close to 78. But when I dialed it down to 77 because one of my corals wasn't thriving it went haywire with wildly swinging temps from 76 - 81. I unplugged it and recalibrated it per the manufacturers instructions three times but it has not helped. I have emailed the company twice via there website with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Meade

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and even worse customer support
customer_reviews.text: Calibration was easy. And it worked great. Until it died after about 10 months of use. Don’t waste your money if you’re looking for durability. I sent the heater to their customer support/warranty center. I was supposed to be notified with 6-8 weeks as to whether the unit would be repaired or replaced. It has been more than six months and nothing. Follow up emails go unanswered. Do not buy from these people. Do yourself a favor and buy Aqueon or like. Seriously. Eheim is the worst in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SMM99

customer_reviews.title: Return customer, happy again
customer_reviews.text: Nothing says a good product like a return customer. I’ve never counted on the temperature dial, which is adjustable if you want that to be accurate. But, a few simple adjustments using a quality digital thermometer and I can tune these in pretty easily, and they will hold the temperature very well. Also seems to be an upgraded design since my last purchase, so far it appears to be a good improvement.
customer_reviews.author: David M.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Bad thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this would work, one of the better rated heaters out there. But (maybe I got the one bad one) I put this in my 29g Bio-Cube set at 79 degrees, checked thermometer next day and it was 85.6 degrees. Unacceptable. I went back to my Aqueon 100w and the temperature stays about 78.5. I guess more expensive doesn't always mean better
customer_reviews.author: D. White

customer_reviews.title: Great product excellent temp control
customer_reviews.text: I have ran the 25W unit in a 10 gallon for 2 years and it is excellent. Temp is held steady and even. The dial is somewhat inaccurate and stiff to turn but if you have a good thermometer in the tank I have found I can keep the water in a very specific temp range. So much so that my neon tetras have actually spawned! These fish are notoriously hard to breed and very picky about temp (must be 77 degrees F). Major drawbacks are very poor suction ability and a crusty dial for setting temp.
customer_reviews.author: Misarakedad

customer_reviews.title: Holds a good steady temperature.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heater. Holds a good steady temperature in my 120 gallon aquarium. Only issue...it is big. If your looking to hide your heater, maybe go with 2 smaller ones instead of one big one. This is a great heater at a very good price. Reliable so far. The temperature seems to hold true to the dial setting at the top of the heater. Fully submersible. I highly recommend....UPDATE February 2019..heater is now been in continuous use for over a year and working perfectly. Holding a accurate consistent temperature...UPDATE AGAIN February 2019 one week after last update...it failed. I got approximately 14 months out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny J.

customer_reviews.title: No auto shutoff feature.
customer_reviews.text: Heater just exploded on me. The reason i purchased this was for the auto shutoff feature. It looks like the overflow on my sump failed and the water drained out exposing the heater. The heater appears to have no auto shut off contrary to whats advertised and melted the straps holding it in place then fell to a small pocket of water and the change in temp caused it to explode. Note where it fell it landed on sand so it did not explode from landing on a hard surface. The tank doesn't seem to have suffered from electrical damage. This brand is a no go for me here on out.
customer_reviews.author: marcos vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like your fish well done
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a POS. Has never worked consistently. I have tried to keep the temp at 82 since I've had it. This thing always runs cold or hot. Lately it's been running hot. REALLY hot. So I've had to lower the temp to compensate. I set it at 79 yesterday. Come home this evening and it is 87!!! COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE. As far as I'm concerned, this company has absolutely zero quality control, reliability, or trustworthiness. I will NEVER buy a Eheim Jager product again as long as I live. F--- You Eheim Jager!!!
customer_reviews.author: Werner Faymann

customer_reviews.title: Defective Fish Tank Heater
customer_reviews.text: I was exited to purchase this heater for my fish tank. The reviews are good and this is a great brand (I have other items in this brand and they all worked long-term). BUT, I was upset to discover that the heater quit working after only using it for 6 weeks. I was wanting to return it or exchange it but the ad did not give me that option. This is very discouraging!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Kuester

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the longevity yet, but we recently got a hatching red ear slider turtle and were given a heater from a friend. The heater appeared to be on, but the water seemed cold and our turtle was very inactive and just sat in his plant all day. Once we bought and installed this heater, there has not been a day where he isn't swimming or basking every second. He is so much happier now!
customer_reviews.author: Monette T. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 weeks at the temp I set
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 2 weeks then didn’t keep my tank at the temperature I need/ had it set to. No matter what my house temperature was, this heater would keep my tank at 65.... I had it set to 75. I tried raising it to 83 and my tank got to around 67 sometimes 70. I went to Walmart after losing 3 fish in 2 days and bought a smaller, cheaper, 200w heater and it got my tank at the right temperature over night. I am very disappointed in this product and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 15 months then died
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product EXCEPT that it was Ordered on March 31, 2018 and died July 10, 2019. I will update this review if the 3 year guarantee replaces the product
customer_reviews.author: blueeyes

customer_reviews.title: Are there any reliable Aquarium Heaters !!??
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to turn at top to a numbered temperature position & it doesn’t keep the water at the temperature set (bought this more expensive one since people said it keep water close to chosen temp.its 10 degrees less ) On a cold Porch it doesn’t & so I’m stuck with it now since can’t return It,my Koi need the little heat it makes now...
customer_reviews.author: DEBRA In NJ

customer_reviews.title: Temp control not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a saltwater reef tank, which requires very precise temperatures between 77-78F. After going through the set up process described in the manual, I plugged in the unit and set it to 77 degrees. I came back just a couple hours later to water temps at nearly 80 degrees! I immediately removed this heater and plugged the older one back in. So much for “precise temperature control”. Absolute junk. I’ll use this POS to heat up my rodi water. Do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lingram

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat went bad pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat gave up after a week or so of usage. Has been working fine initially but today I noticed that indicator light was not turning off and I'm glad I touched the aquarium glass and found out it was hot before it turned into a disaster! This is a well rated heater, so I'll try my luck with a replacement unit and see how it goes and will update this review. ------------ 2/7/2016 UPDATE: The replacement unit is holding up quite well so far. Another UPDATE: Shortly after last update, i figured the replacement unit also stopped shutting off. I removed this heater and never going back to it again.
customer_reviews.author: Raheel

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a heater that works for me!
customer_reviews.text: First heater I've purchased in a long time that's actually worked. Granted, I don't spend more than $35 or so, but you should be able to get one to heat < 100g of water for that. This one actually keeps the temp within a few tenths. Most thermometers I've purchased either can't get the water temp high enough (even though they are rated for much more water volume), or refuse to allow the water to cool lower than a certain temp (that's too high), even if set to the lowest temp.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Started malfunctioning after about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: These are decent heaters, but I am considering other brands at this point. I purchased this one and others (others purchased elsewhere) and the temperature started spiking on some of the ones purchased in the same time period. This was despite adjusting to a lower temperature. I went ahead a replaced the ones not working right. It's not worth the risk. A malfunctioning heater can literally boil your fish. I would suggest doing some research before purchasing your next heater. I have seen other reviews and comments on fish forums noting increasing problems with their heaters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I am a marine aquarist and have 180, 150, 30, 8, and 5 gallon saltwater tanks. I have tried multiple different heaters and I have found that nothing beats an Eheim Jager! I use them (various wattages) in all of my tanks, even the nanos, and have used them for 7 years. Again, I have used others and none heat as well or hold up as well as a Jager. I use an Apex controller on my 180 and 150 and keep these plugged through that - never a temp fluctuation.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Gill

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 6 weeks or so in my 5.5 gallon tank. I've had no issues with temperature control. I did have to calibrate slightly, but it matches up to the thermometer I have in my tank. My only complaint would be it's size. It kind of looks clunky in my small tank. I know it's fully submersible and I can lay it down, but I didn't want it close to the gravel and it would also be too close to my filter. Overall though, it doesn't take away from the 5 stars I've given this. I'm very happy and would recommend and purchase another Eheim heater.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Repacked defective product
customer_reviews.text: Box torn open at both ends and splitting at seams. Looks like it came off the junk shelf. Safety ring was off tube indicating someone removed it (probably the first customer who bought it). i should smash the glass because this seller will most likely try to repackage this heater. By far the worse seller i ever dealt with because only a low life would try to pass this off as a new product. Oh and of course the heater doesn't work. I should smash the glass before returning this because this defective product will most likely be passed off to another customer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: So far it is working as it should and I have not seen any leaking. About double the size of my old 50W Tetra heater that conked out (picture comparison). First impression is good quality. UPDATE: So even though I liked it... it would not let me alter the temperature at ALL. It was stuck on the same one. I followed all the directions and it would not change! Ended up returning it and I'm disappointed because I had good initial impressions
customer_reviews.author: Caroline S

customer_reviews.title: This is the first time I have ever been disappointed in an eheim purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I've used Eheim for years and it has always stood for quality. This is the first time I have ever been disappointed in an eheim purchase. Received this heater, removed from packaging, allowed to acclimate for 30 minutes, then plugged in. Heater electrified the water. Unplugged and removed heater, no more charge to the water. Reinstalled, water electrified again. Never experienced this before with any eheim product, but this experience has certainly left me "shocked".
customer_reviews.author: chris coughran

customer_reviews.title: Hot Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great heater. Takes a bit to calibrate it just right, but that's a good thing. Lots of heaters say 78 degrees but if you test it with a thermometer you'll see it's off by a few degrees. On a 150 gallon total volume system this lone heater will pull the temp up 3 degrees in about an hour. Really have no complaints. One word of caution to tank owners out there: GET YOURSELF A CONTROLLER!!! All heaters will eventually fail. If it fails in the off position you'll probably figure it out before things start dying. But should this heater fail in the on position you are gonna have hours if your lucky. Minutes if you're not.
customer_reviews.author: amnesiac

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August 2018, worked well, now it is broken, it no longer shuts off! Nearly killed all my fish!! Temp is set at 80 and it is already up to 86!! Do not buy! **UPDATE** I contacted Eheim Support. They will not refund the money only repair or replace! They suck! Will never buy from again! BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Maaike Derksen

customer_reviews.title: Place it where current/water flow is strong
customer_reviews.text: Its reliable and undestructible, I also like the fact that you can calibrate it your self.. but it was a bit tricky to calibrate, at first I though it was over heating but it was just out of calibration. It took me a while to get it right but it was worth it. Mi biggest mistake was placement. Make sure you place the heating part next to your filter inlet or outlet where current is strong, that will keep the heated water circulating and keeping eve temp all over your aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it died....after the no-return date.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this heater in April 2017 and it has already quit working for me. The light shows that it is on, but it is no longer heating my water. I have had to raise my nighttime temp in the house to keep my tank from cooling down too much. Unfortunately, it is past the return date of course.
customer_reviews.author: Isidorius

customer_reviews.title: I think I received a dud
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heater based on a mountain of positive reviews. I regret my purchase since the heater is a whopping 11 degrees off! I know that you can calibrate these, but only up to 8 degrees. I even went out and got a third temperature probe because I couldn't believe how off it was. Fortunately, I am using a temperature controller, so this heater will not be baking my tank. If you purchase this, please note that a temperature controller is an absolute 100% Necessity.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Great price, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Great price, excellent quality, easy to set up, and super fast shipping (arrived in one day). I got the 125 W for a 40 gallon breeder tank. Set at 93, it heats my tank to 78 degrees Fahrenheit. It took two days for it to do this, from 62 degrees Fahrenheit. UPDATE: after temps rose inside the apartment above 70° F, it finally started to reach what temp the thermostat was set at. Under 70° F though, I had to set at higher temps to keep the tank temp stable.
customer_reviews.author: ramon d.

customer_reviews.title: Does heat up your tank
customer_reviews.text: I placed a 50 watt Eheim Jager Heater into my 10 gallon tank with live plants. After waiting the 30 minutes for heater to acclimate before plugging it in, the tank water was 77F at 11 pm. I set heater to about 81 degrees. Heater took 40 minutes to increase water temp just one degree higher, to 78F. So I raised temp to 86F and 30 minutes later water temp was 79F. Next morning Tank water is 83 degrees F. This is a great working heater I just have to recalibrate, which is a great option this heater has and not many others have. I recommend this heater so far. After recalibrating I will try to post another review!
customer_reviews.author: Mia L

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and will not hold temperature
customer_reviews.text: I would have contacted the seller for a refund but I purchased it last year and am just getting around to using it. If you set the temp higher than the water temp it will turn on until it reaches approx the right temp. Actually I used a lab calibrated temp indicator to get it where I want. It's off by about 7°F. Then it will shut off as expected but never turn back on again to maintain the temp. If you touch or move it then it will turn back on but then fail again. Over and over and over. My last Eheim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep my fishes tank at a steady temperature
customer_reviews.text: [EDIT - My Beta died because her water got too warm] My heat fluctuates too much. When I first plugged this in, it was several hours before it started to warm up the water. This afternoon I checked the temperature and it was pleasantly warm: close to 80. Now upon arriving home I checked and the temp is below 70 I doubt there are external factors causing this: I have my Betta's 5 gallon tank away from any windows and the apartment I live in has controlled heating that stays at a constant temperature. I don't know what the problem could be.
customer_reviews.author: Moniker

customer_reviews.title: Was nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater in August of 2018, as I had been pleased with the one I bought for my 20 gallon aquarium in the past. This one worked flawlessly until about a week ago. It hasn’t overheated or exploded or killed anything, but it’s definitely no longer heating. My betta’s aquarium is set for 70-80 degrees and the heater hitting the mark dead on. Then for some reason this week I got to work and found the temp sitting at 70 Fahrenheit. I’ll be buying a new heater and it probably won’t be made by this company.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat does not work
customer_reviews.text: It always heats up the water to 92/93 degree F regardless of the temperature setting. I believe, I received defective unit, and the thermostat is not working.I will try to use it with Inkbird temperature controller. Please test it before relying on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Strong heater with poor seals
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these back in The middle of June 2015. Each one went into 2 220 gallon tanks with glass lids. They were dialed in and heated my tanks to 80 in a few hours after filling them with cool tap water. They are super long and work well. The problem, or soon to be problem, is that I have condensation on the inside of both heaters near the top. I fear the water will short out the heaters soon. For such a staple in the aquarium industry, I am super disappointed that these heaters are not sealed and made better. I will definitely steer other hobbyist away if asking opinions on heater brands.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have had quite a number of tank heaters over the years, and this one seems to be the best. It has a dependable thermostat, and it has a long tube surface area for temperature exchange with the water. Most of these units don't last more than a year for me, and I haven't had this one that long, so I can't speak to longevity. Mounting these unit horizontally near the bottom of the tank helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dinoguy

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution- Malfunctioned and lost all of my fish
customer_reviews.text: This is a greatly priced heater, but you get what you pay for. Worked well for about a year until malfunctioned and overheated my tank. One morning I wake up and find that all of my fish are dead. Thermometer shows that tank water was 89 which is why all of my fish died. When this happened, the heater was still on and hot even though tank water 10 degrees higher than setting. Worked well for about a year until one day overheated my tank and killed everything. I am staying far away from this brand moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: best heater made
customer_reviews.text: these are my go to heater and I have owned several thru out the years . I have tried other brands but all those just fail over time these eheims never change and are extremely reliable once you get them dialed in , sure they cost a little more but well worth it . only one thing I would change is I wish they were shorter , I am using this 125w in a 20 long so it is a little long , I have to run it slanted , no big deal
customer_reviews.author: G Craig

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after about a month.
customer_reviews.text: This heater was doing pretty well to keep our 75 gallon at a goood temperature for about a month, then we noticed the tank was cold and the light was off. It was still plugged in and everything else on the tank was still working and if we fiddle with it, it will work for about another 5 minutes then stops working again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Expected more from Eheim than an expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Feb 28, 2018 and the unit has already failed. Didn't even last 5 months. Indicator light turns on. However, no heat is produced and it could have been real costly. Thank goodness my wife noticed. Very disappointed. Expected more from Eheim than an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER S DENT

customer_reviews.title: Will not allow temperature adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 weeks now. The temperature will not move from 82-F. I've calibrated it, and adjusted the temperature to be lower than displayed, and it is still stuck at 82F. The only good part is, the temperature is held stable; but, if you can't adjust temperature, it's somewhat useless. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Nali

customer_reviews.title: Piece Of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your old Ebo Jager! Used to be the "go to" heater but not anymore. Won't hold a consistent temp, dial on top sucks, 50 Watt heater takes forever to heat a 5.5 gallon tank. What a pile of junk!
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Best aquarium heater on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this Heater over any other. I have 2 25 watt heaters for my 5 gallons and 1 50 watt heater for my 10 gallon for over a year with zero problems. The temperature is normally 1-2 degrees Fahrenheit of whatever you set it, just make sure you calibrate the heater correctly. Very shattered resistant as well.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Wild readings
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this heater, as I'm unable to neither set an accurate nor a stable temperature. I have it set at 73 to have a water temperate range of 76 to 79 from two separate temperature measurements. The red offset indicator is useless. My 10-dollar Tetra heater is more accurate than this.
customer_reviews.author: Youn

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying the best. I've had this heater less then a year. The temp fluctuates 2 degrees. I had the heater jump up to 86 degrees for no reason. It took me all day to get the temp back down. Hard to see how to adjust. Not user friendly. Won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: James and Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but might not be the best.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad heater, but only lasted for about 3 years. It's a bit of a pain to set initially, but once it was set to the right temp it rarely deviated. I'm not sure if mine had a faulty seal that gave out, or just a short lifespan. I've had Aqueon and Marineland heaters in the past that have worked for 7-10 years and thought going with an Eheim would give me longer use based on the reviews. Again, not a bad heater with consideration to how well it maintained water temperature, just not the longest lifespan. 3 Stars for an okay heater.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: so good. I will keep my fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I will keep my fingers crossed. It is just about dead on the money for exact temps. That makes me feel a lot better with my fish not having to go thru dramatic temperatures changes.. It is very stabilizing. I knocked a star off because one of the rubber feet that attaches to the glass was missing out of the box when I received it, but I did not want to send it back just for a small reason. As long as my fish do not knock it out of place, I won't complain. It would be nice to get it in the mailbox, but I can't see that happening.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Patton

customer_reviews.title: if you want a dependable heater
customer_reviews.text: I am very particular to what I use in my tanks. I want products that are dependable, accurate and long lasting. These heaters fit my requirements. I would advise anyone to use these. GREAT. The only thing I would recommended is changing the suction cups to magnetic holders.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Smolinski

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated to operate
customer_reviews.text: Too complicated. Instructions are not clear. They tell you to turn the red arrow to calibrate (to the number on the blue ring that matched your actual measured temperature) which is fine but now it’s ingructing to turn the blue ring to the desired temperature. It does not state what to line it up with. There’s about five different parts/marks that could be (including the red arrow). Right now I am cooking my fish set at 79 but temp is 85.
customer_reviews.author: joe gwin

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the hobby for 40 years. I have tried pretty much every type/brand of heater. Ehiem is the most efficient and best there is in my opinion. Look at the spec. 300 watts will heat 264 gallons. I have one in a 200 gallon system, keeps it with in a degree, about ten degrees over room temp.
customer_reviews.author: JJMLLC

customer_reviews.title: HIT OR MISS! This heater has potential.
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently awaiting for the third 75 watt unit of this heater. The first one I received did not have any suction mounting cups in the box, although it is possible that it was a prior Amazon return. The second unit I received would not keep an accurate temperature in my 20 gallon tank. I had it set to multiple temperatures and it was consistently heating my aquarium to 80 degrees. Attempts to calibrate it over a week or two with the red calibrating dial resulted in no success. I am currently waiting on the third replacement. It's a shame because I have another 50W version that has worked just fine in another tank for almost a year.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Literally stopped working overnight. My tropical tank temp dropped 10 degrees before I caught the problem. The real problem is that the light on the heater is still on, giving no visual warning that it wasn't working. Thankfully I have a backup heater to bring the tank back up. I would strongly recommend you keep a backup heater handy if you purchase this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Franz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Heater
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty accurate right out of the box. The dials feel heavy duty and the thing just feels solid. It also looks better than most heaters.
customer_reviews.author: Duy

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: A good solid build, great design and very accurate. Has held my nano reef at a steady temperature with zero fluctuations. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: len s lindeman

customer_reviews.title: Great heater!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best heaters on the market. After calibration the heater is spot on. Make sure to follow instructions and calibrate as required. The only negative is that the heater is huge. If you usually buy higher powered heaters this one may actually not fit in your tank vertically. I chose a horizontal in order to leave the plugged in while I do water changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kosmos99

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat to desired temp
customer_reviews.text: This heater only works when it wants too, I bought it to heat up 10-20 gallons of water knowing it's for 100+ gallon fish tanks I figured it would definitely get my water to 93 degrees maybe a little higher, but I was extremely wrong, my water barely gets to 60 degrees with it cranked up to 93 and turned on for 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not Up To Eheim standerds dosent do the job
customer_reviews.text: Not the great quality you would expect from Eheim but if you can find the 50w or get the 100w in stock everywhere and more reliable my last Eheim 50w lasted 26 years and I still have my 100w 32 years :) so far the 25w just docent make the grade F-
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for my smaller tank!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this in a 3 gallon tank after finding failure with many lower wattage but always on heaters. Those tend to be unstable and keep the water too hot. This one is keeping the water at a beautiful 78 degrees consistently. I did have to put it horizontally but it’s working greatZ
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Don't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: Died after about a year. Worked ok before that, besides being SUPER hard to set the temp. A year is not long for a heater of this type. The coil is completely sprung. Otos dead. Won't be using this brand again. Hope my other ones don't die soon. Will be watching my temps.
customer_reviews.author: Cy Hy

customer_reviews.title: Over heating after only 3 months of used
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater because of its good name for my 75 gal discus tank. I found out all my fish died this morning, the tank is over heated to 105 degrees F. I lost about $2000 with of fish. I regretted trusting Ehiem brand.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great heater, but it's large.
customer_reviews.text: This heater keeps my water temp really stable. It's great from a functionality standpoint. I also have the 75 watt version. It has been a good heater. Durable construction. I set it at 82 and I got 80 in a 120 gallon. It can be calibrated, but I haven't done that yet. The downside of this thing is that it's giant. You don't really know until you get it into your tank. It's hard to hide in my particular tank. It's a 5 star product, but understand what you are getting as far as the size.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Stuck at full tilt.
customer_reviews.text: Mine seems to be stuck at full blast 100% of the time. I adjusted the temperature down a few degrees, and it still seems to be heating the water beyond what the thermostat is set at.
customer_reviews.author: Lars M. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Woudn't Consider Any Other Brand  :)
customer_reviews.text: The EHEIM heaters are the definitive heaters to use for your tanks. I have one for each of my two cichlid tanks, and another in my turtle tank. Using a thermometer I can be assured that they keep the waters at a constant temperature. Good durable quality means I don't have to worry about my crazy turtle breaking it. Just take it out and clean it whenever you do a water change, and they will stay looking like new. I'd recommend going with the biggest heater that will fit in your tank, as they are adjustable and you can always turn down the heat.
customer_reviews.author: zoiberg137

customer_reviews.title: Garbage....
customer_reviews.text: Shorted out and killed all my fish after just a month of use... do not buy. Suposed to be the best... hardly
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: This Heater Is A Beast
customer_reviews.text: This heater is a beast. It was able to keep my 40 gallon aquarium above 80 degrees in the winter in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: In2quads

customer_reviews.title: trash without a temp controller
customer_reviews.text: Spent a couple of weeks trying to dial in the adjustments on this thing and nothing was working to keep the temp consistent. When I first got it, it was heating my tank to near 90. Finally I just decided to buy a digital temp controller and set the dials on this piece of trash to ~85, while the temp controller kicks it on at 78 and off at 80. works like a charm that way.
customer_reviews.author: daniel lohwasser

customer_reviews.title: The item itself has very bad packaging for it being glass
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and both arrived broken at the bottom. The item itself has very bad packaging for it being glass. Good thing I tested them first. I put the one which had the least hairline fractures in a bucket to test it out and it rose the level past 90 degrees. I tested it at the lowest setting, then middle, then highest. Each time my the water was very hot and the thermometer read near 100 degrees. I had high hopes for this but I'm scared to try for a third time. I would really like a heater which can be set for a specific temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Manny CJ

customer_reviews.title: Mind your dimensions!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic aquarium heaters. BUT the 300 W i got for what looked like a deal compared to others of quality was in fact extremely long! I believe they make this very clear and with my experience i should know better. I figured that it has a larger surface area to heat thus creating less need to heat tightly compacted coils to any extreme. Overall the thing was to long for the sump and and way to long for an in tank application. Other then that the heater came on time and was as expected a very high quality device.
customer_reviews.author: Granty Grant

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: 50 watt Lasted six months, then stuck on. Took my clownfish fry tank to 85 degrees. No visible water intrusion, just stuck on. 300 watt lasted just over a year in a 100 g stock tank for mixing saltwater, then stuck on.
customer_reviews.author: Zephrant

customer_reviews.title: Precise And Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Quality heater, solid constructon, and accurate. This is not a fault, but I hate suction cups on aquarium products simply because the heater can become easily dislodged from the suction cups. Trying to remove the suction cups from the aquarium is at times, hard to do. Temperature dial on my thermometer was "stiff" and difficult to adjust. I am hower still pleased with the thermometer, and while it is large, it fits inside my 5 gallon betta tank perfectly. I would recommend this to other aquarium enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Good design but not reliable. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great design and fits well for a 55-gallons aquarium. The heater worked as expected for the first 3 months. After 3 months the heater seems to only work intermittently. The heater light only comes on when the electrical cable is held in certain way, and turns off otherwise. Seems like a bad soldering job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eheim Customer Service is non-existent
customer_reviews.text: I paid shipping to return the heater under warranty but Eheim Customer Service won't respond to any of my emails nor the online service form over the past 2 and a half months. I'm disappointed to write a negative review like this but Eheim customer service has really let me down. At this point I would highly recommend avoiding Eheim products.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Description
customer_reviews.text: I'm debating whether or not I need to return this (unused) heater. The only description I found about tank size before ordering was 'up to 79 gal. But once I received the order I see that although one side of the box reads 'up to 79 gal', the other side of the same box has a chart (not in Amazon's description) reading that this (150w) heater is for tanks of '53-79' g. My tanks are 20 - 30g, so it's much smaller than 53g.This should be clearly noted in description; it is not. I'm not sure if it's safe to use in a smaller tank, or not...
customer_reviews.author: stephenothera

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use Eheim Jager heaters in all of my aquariums. They are worth the money. I have yet to have one fail. I've had several fluvals, aquatops, aqeons, and tetras. They have all failed on me. Quality product! Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ponson416

customer_reviews.title: suction cups are horrible because it only supports the heater on one side
customer_reviews.text: DAY 5 on calibration.. bought 2 heaters 300w each ... 180 gallon tank.. suction cups are horrible because it only supports the heater on one side, so it doesn’t stay on straight horizontally.. the KNOBS !! You need extra un human finger strength and long nails to calibrate and turn temp up and down .. What a headache!! Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Fady Shia

customer_reviews.title: set to 72 the calibration ring may be nice, but it's still off by 2 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. I have it hooked to a 75 Gallon freshwater tank, sideways halfway down. set to 72 the calibration ring may be nice, but it's still off by 2 degrees. not enough adjustment there. get yourself a floating thermometer and a sticky one for calibration. NEVER trust the marks on the heater. That said, it never strays more that +-1.5 deg safety tip. always unplug the heater before pulling out of water or adjusting the temp. also, after pulling out of water, wait 10 minutes before plugging back in. thermal shock can shatter the glass, and potentially electrocute your fish (this is a good practice no matter the brand/style heater you buy)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered three of these. Two 200 and one 300 watt. The 300w was spot on from the package. I'm going to have to adjust the other two but no big deal. Once set they maintain the required temp with a degree or two which is most important to me. All three used on a 75 bare bottom tank and the 200w enough to raise the temperature 12 degrees above room temperature. Thought I was going to need the 300 but going with the 200 makes more sense should the sensor get stuck as the tank shouldn't get too hot. I have a few more 75s and getting more of these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GARRIGA

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT ORDER!!! I put this is my tank and set it low (68 degrees) to start off since I had to go out of town for the weekend since my old heater stopped working. I did the low setting just in case the thermostat in the unit was slightly off. However, I got home and the tank was 93 degrees with 9 of my kuhli loach, 6 otos, 2 black mollies, and a sword tail, Red Cherry Shrimp and Amano Shrimp all DEAD.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Czumaj

customer_reviews.title: Broke with in 2 weeks.  Absurd length hard to balance.  Poor suction cups fall off during every water change.
customer_reviews.text: Broke with in 2 weeks. Absurd length hard to balance. Poor suction cups fall off during every water change.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gold standard for good reason
customer_reviews.text: Able to be calibrated by the user. Reliable. Eheim is the gold standard in the hobby for a reason. If you want to keep your tanks and fish safe while keeping the water the right temp, these are great. Using the 300w on my 75g tank. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: M. LeClair

customer_reviews.title: fantastic heater
customer_reviews.text: This heater works great. I have a 250 gal tank (4' x 2' x 2-1/2'). I had two 300 watt heater that stop working within days of each other so my tanks temp went from 78deg. to 69 deg. put in my new Eheim (one heater) in the tank and the water was up to 75 deg in 24 hour. Fantastic heater. i had previously purchased Zacro BH582 Submersible Aquarium Heater from amazon but they were junk, returned them to amazon for a refund, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: henry j

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was bad
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was horrible. The heater was hanging out of the box when it arrived. I inspected it and it seemed fine. After a week of it in the fish tank I'm very happy with its performance. The 300watt heater is huge and very effective. I would buy again. Lost a star because of packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month before it stopped keeping temperature! When ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a month before it stopped keeping temperature! When I need 80* for warm water plecos, I expect 80*, not 71* before the heater shuts off! Replacement is the same. I am lucky if the heater heats to 76* before it shuts off! Waste of money, just go with Catalina instead!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Launders

customer_reviews.title: Trusty and reliable Eheim heaters
customer_reviews.text: Eheim products have always been trusty and reliable for me. Been in the aquarium hobby for over ten years and the original heaters are still working... I just keep adding to my hobby collection LOL very easy to set temp, easy to read instructions included.
customer_reviews.author: J Rivera

customer_reviews.title: great heater
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this heater. I have tried 3 others and this is the first one to not have many fluctuations. a 3 degree fluctuation out of nowhere was not uncommon with the others. Every time I look it's the same now. Great!
customer_reviews.author: K. B. O.

customer_reviews.title: Old Reliable
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong wrong with Eheim! The eheim-jager glass heater is no exception. I’ve been using these exact heaters for 15+ years with no issues. Like a lot of Eheim products there are no bells and whistles or trendy technology, just simply good engineering and quality. Buy one heater for the life of your aquarium and don’t worry about it again!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Just My Experience
customer_reviews.text: I got this heater and it was working great for a month or 2. Than, it started heating my tank super hot randomly. When I contacted Eheim support, they were of no help. I had to buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chef  Wanna Be

customer_reviews.title: Temp way off. Not trustworthy.
customer_reviews.text: Does it heat? Yes, with horrible accuracy. Should have gone aqueon pro. Set to 80 and was pruning plants when I noticed it felt like a hot tub. Eheim is supposed to be good. It was almost 90. Fish are still alive. Worst part was I immediately tured the dial down and noticed afterwards the red light was still on. Off by 10 degrees? Not great.
customer_reviews.author: CCrawMor

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Beware! I had this heater for about two weeks and all was normal. I had set it at 82 degrees. I check my temperature daily with an electric thermometer. Today I checked it and my tank was 96 degrees! I'm amazed none of my fish died yet. I tried turning the temperature down and the heater stayed on. Needless to say I cannot use the heater anymore. Faulty. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Best heater
customer_reviews.text: From my research these heaters heat for less electricity, a plus for me at . 26c /kw delivered . Thanks. I have 3, 2 in a 55 (one as backup-only one stays on with calibrated - one is plenty) and another in a 26 gallon by a drafty winter window ... Yeah, it's moving this spring.
customer_reviews.author: M. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Longevity not too great :( under 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Since purchase from Amazon It worked great for the first 6 months , I recently lower the temp to prepare for planting plants in my aquarium and the light was still on and heater kept heating. Eheim heater had created moister inside so I quickly turn it off and went to the store to buy different heater. Since I have discus in my tank there easily feel the temp drop and they get freaked out. Sorry to say about the eheim since in the past I had great experience. The thermostat seems to a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this heater!!
customer_reviews.text: This was another item in my Amazon cart when I purchased my Fluval Edge and all the accessories I would need to get it going. I have it on the back wall laying sideways so that it is not as noticeable. Can you see it? lol, It works beautifully, and it was very easy to install. Everything you a see in the picture was purchased from Amazon except the gravel and the fish:) Amazon is my favorite online "store".
customer_reviews.author: shihtzumom

customer_reviews.title: Works, but HUGE.
customer_reviews.text: This heater is ginormous considering it's intended for small tanks. Wouldn't fit in the filter compartment of my Spec V, so put it in the main tank for a while (sideways, too tall to go upright) until I could get a smaller heater to fit back with the pump. It seems to work fine, it's just so big!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy T.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate settings
customer_reviews.text: Have tried four times now to get this set correctly. It runs hotter than what it's setting is and recalibration is -not- effective or accurate. Now turned calibration indicator to it's maximum position and have set thermostat 5 degrees lower to obtain 78 degrees. Bought this expecting exceptional temperature control but I might as well have purchased a Chinese one for 1/4 the price. No better than those units. VERY disappointed with this. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JohnB58

customer_reviews.title: BAD AFTER SALES
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to contact EHEIM SUPPORT FOR MANY weeks , they are unbeliavable unresponsible, don't talk by phone. BAD support if you need then. I have a perfect unit ( visually , it's shows up that is heating at LAMP , but no HEAT is produced )
customer_reviews.author: Vinicius Marques De Bernardi

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye on temp.
customer_reviews.text: I Bought as a backup for our tanks. We had an older heater go bad, and we replaced it with the Eheim 300. About 30 days in, the water temp started climbing, no matter how low we set it for. Replaced with the other 300 and we are keeping a close eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Cox

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETELY FALSE CLAIM OF TEMP CONTROL!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I’ve ever bought on amazon! The precise temperature control is a total LIE! My poor beloved Betta fish suffered as a result - even though I set it at 77 degrees the damn thing kept heating a 10 gallon tank past 86 degrees and I had to watch the poor fish every two hours to check the water temperature - THIS DOES NOT AUTO SHUT OFF AT ANY TEMP AND KEEPS GOING WITHOUT ANYTHING TO CONTROL IT. DONT BUY - I’ve learned my lesson - buy TopFin heaters from Petsmart or Petco instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Eheim Jager Aquarium Thermostat Heater
product_meta.description: Wattage:300 WattsAll 9 EHEIM Heater models are 100% fully submersible and come with a new TruTemp dial that allows the user to recalibrate the heater within a +/- 0.5F degree accurancy for precise temperature readings.
feature_bullets: Thermo safey control protects against running dry
Will automatically turn off when water level dips too low
TruTemp dial recalibrates the heater for precise temperature regulation
Made of shock resistant and shatter proof glass for fresh or marine water
On/Off indicator light for at-a-glance monitoring

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
